intro: Sairocarpus californicus, commonly known as the California sainfoin, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. Sairocarpus californicus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with limited rainfall.
